I've saw somewhere previously that python only use 2g (or 1g? sorry I cannot remember clearly) memory in Mac OS since it was installed in virtual environment

If you are really using a virtual environment, it cannot, as far as I know, limit the memory a process can use. If you're using a virtual machine, or a container system such as Docker, it can.

body:
> I've saw somewhere previously that python only use 2g (or 1g? sorry I cannot remember clearly) memory in Mac OS since it was installed in virtual environment

If you are really using a virtual _environment_, it cannot, as far as I know, limit the memory a process can use. If you're using a virtual _machine_, or a container system such as Docker, it can.
